title: Google‚Äôs Email Service?

title: Almost perfect
text: I wish this app would let me easily attach actual files from my device local storage or pull copies from google drive. There doesn‚Äôt seem to be a way to do this when replying to an email on an Apple device. I can only share files in Google drive which is not how I want to send attachments. Fix this problem and I‚Äôll update to five stars.

title: Unable to remove formatting
text: Until you are able to paste and remove formatting this app is useless. It‚Äôs almost as if the people who developed this app have never used it themselves as a daily driver. Nowadays emails are crafted with a lot of copy and pasting and there should be a way to paste as text only or to highlight and remove all formatting. All emails from this app look like a garbled mess. The one and only reason I use this app is because they took away push/exchange connections.

title: Notification Sounds Not Accessibility Friendly
text: The Classic notification sound has recently disappeared and my devices now use the Welcome sound by default and I am missing important emails because I cannot hear the Gmail app notifications. All of the currently available built-in Gmail app sounds are either too low volume or too short in duration to be heard properly. This is causing an accessibility issue that was not a problem when the Classic sound was available to be selected as it was louder and easier to hear. Google Support pages show that the Classic sound should still be an option but it is not listed in the app anymore. Please bring it back and make the Classic sound available as an option again or let us use the built in default iOS system sounds as the current sound options cannot be heard very well.

title: Delete
text:
With the amount of tracking Google does there is no way I‚Äôll keep any Google product on my phone.

Google keeps tabs on your who you email most frequently and there is no way to turn the feature off. There‚Äôs no way that they won‚Äôt mine your data to make money. They have no interest in your privacy.
